text:
Hello fellow Superpathers,

I saw a post in one of my writing Facebook groups, that <http://Medium.com|Medium.com> sent out a mass email the other day threatening partner program deactivation for people with less than 100 followers. I have been newer to the platform and sharing on there for less than a year. I, unfortunately, was one of the people that was gifted the email saying I need 100 followers to maintain earnings within the Partner Program and I am currently at 61. If anyone else got this email as well and is active on the platform, would love to assist with a follow train to help people maintain access to this monetization option on Medium. Here is a link to my profile. Looking forward to connecting with many of you on there as well!
<https://theglamtechie.medium.com/>

attachments.text: Read writing from Amanda Renee on Medium. Just another writer trying to pave her own way in the world. Former cybersecurity pro turned technical writer and content marketer.
attachments.title: Amanda Renee – Medium

text:
:white_check_mark: If you don't give somebody instructions on how to build something, or don't give someone a recipe on how to make something, how do you expect that they create what you want?

A well defined content brief is the instruction manual and recipe that SEO content writers need to ensure that they are hitting all the relevant subtopics and business objectives. And guess what? Everyone has a different approach to building out content briefs. The more perspectives you have on how others are producing briefs—<https://youtu.be/KrGuQksy_Y8|we hosted a panel last year which covered 3 different approaches to content briefs>—the better you can craft a content brief that works for you and your organization.

And that's why we're excited to have Rejoice Ojiaku from B-DigitalUK talk about "<https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/1716450304285/WN_Tf7gpwsQQ-S-Ljji98abJA|It's All In The Brief: How to SEOptimise Your Content Briefs for Writers>".

:spiral_note_pad: *Details:*
** Title:* It's All In The Brief: How to SEOptimise Your Content Briefs for Writers
** Speakers:* <https://twitter.com/RejiYates|Rejoice Ojiaku>,  Co-Founder and Content Lead for <https://twitter.com/bdigital_uk|B-DigitalUK>
** Date & time:* Thursday, February 24th, 11:00 AM US Central Time
** Zoom registration page:* <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/6716450304326/WN_Tf7gpwsQQ-S-Ljji98abJA>
** Who should attend:* Attend this webinar for insights on how to approach your SEO content briefs. We'll cover the nuts and bolts of why you need to be briefing your SEO content writers and what to include to give the best guidance.

RSVP to attend live OR receive the webinar recording in your inbox if you can't make it :inbox_tray:

attachments.text: The latest Tweets from #Praganant (@RejiYates). She/Her | SEOer (Content) | Speaker | @bdigital_uk Co-Founder | 2/2 #spaceshost of #BlackInTheWorkspace w/ @enclaudeneuf| Award Winning D&I Advocate. London, England
attachments.title: #Praganant (@RejiYates) | Twitter

text:
Many freelancers struggle with charging for their work, mostly because imposter syndrome agonizes them.

But how many of us would’ve been more confident charging for our services if we’d been taught from a young age that our work has value?

<https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6900141242668208128/|Here’s a guy> who teaches his kid how to edit his podcasts — and pays him for the work.

elements.text:

text:
Is anyone here looking to build up a blogging routine — and publish more? Please join the first of my guided blogging sessions next week. These workshops will be free, always, as a personal mission of mine is to increase access to high-quality storytelling education.

I'm intentionally keeping these workshops small for a few reasons: (1) teacher:student ratio was a major variable in defining my success as a writer throughout my education and (2) A curated, smaller "room" enables a higher degree of trust when it comes to the free exchange of ideas.

You'll notice that a lot of values in my teaching come from the earliest days of the Internet ("old internet"), which was all about the free exchange of ideas, collaboration, and deep intellectual discourse. That's why these workshops will be free of sales pitches — the internet was always intended to be a vehicle for human evolution rather than brute force transactions.

These days, social media has become constricting to deep thinking and self-expression — two mindfulness-oriented disciplines that are critical to personal wellness, career success, and societal wellbeing.

My hope, in helping others solidify their writing practices, is to ignite a spark for meaningful, constructive, and positive problem-solving discourse in the tech industry. When we work towards these goals, as individuals, we see benefits like improved networking, more meaningful conversations, and you guessed it — transactional outcomes that are more natural and less "brute forced."

So far, my first group of students is shaping up to be awesome, and I can tell that the experience will be meaningful. As the date comes closer (February 23), I'll be putting out more reminders and words of encouragement for people to join.

This will be a welcoming, warm environment where you can participate as much or as little as you wish. I hope you will join and/or share this workshop with your colleagues who are looking to take action on writing more in 2022. I look forward to hearing your ideas and reading your work.

We need more sparks of light in the world. Please join me in committing to being one.

<https://lnkd.in/d-4TBrhp>

attachments.fallback: Guided Blogging Session for Leaders, Thinkers, and Builders in Tech - Feb 23 | Hopin
attachments.text: Get tickets to Guided Blogging Session for Leaders, Thinkers, and Builders in Tech, taking place 02/23/2022. Hopin is your source for engaging events and experiences.
